meanings.definition: The quality or state of being floppy.
meanings.sent1: The floppinesses of the old rubber band made it hard to use.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the floppinesses of the wet spaghetti noodles.
meanings.sent3: The floppy-eared puppy's floppinesses always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The floppinesses of the sail in the wind resembled a dancing ghost.
meanings.sent5: The floppinesses of the clown's oversized shoes added to his comedic act.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be limp or loose.
meanings.sent1: The baby's floppinesses in the crib showed how relaxed he was.
meanings.sent2: The floppinesses of the old socks made them fall off easily.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches swayed with a gentle floppinesses in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The floppinesses of the kite's tail made it soar gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The floppinesses of the flag in the wind symbolized freedom and movement.

meanings.sent1: The floppinesses of the deflated balloon made it easy to fold.
meanings.sent2: The floppinesses of the paper made it hard to write on without support.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow's arms had a comical floppinesses in the field.
meanings.sent4: The floppinesses of the rubber band caused it to snap when stretched too far.
meanings.sent5: The floppinesses of the old book's cover showed its well-loved pages within.
